alert.note: Alert for Kershaw; Lee; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 7:59PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lee, northeastern Sumter and east central Kershaw Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 759 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cassatt to 7 miles southwest of Bishopville to Sumter County Airport. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sumter, Bishopville, Mulberry, Lee State Park, Sumter County Airport, Elliott, Mayesville, Lynchburg, Ashwood, Lucknow, Oswego, Manville, St. Charles, Wisacky, Woodrow, Ashland, East Sumter and Shiloh. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 110 and 126. Interstate 95 between mile markers 141 and 146. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
